newsitem.title: FRANCE: Dassault, Aerospatiale merger in spring.
newsitem.headline: Dassault, Aerospatiale merger in spring.

text.p: A planned merger of state-owned Aerospatiale and combat plane maker Dassault Aviation should be completed by the end of the spring, a defence ministry official said on Wednesday.
The official said the merged group would be privatised immediately following the merger.

"If we put everything together...at the end of the spring, the merger will be entirely complete," the offical said. "As for the privatisation of the new group, the government wants it to be done in the immediate aftermath and will ask the two company presidents to think about it now and make proposals."
The official said Dassault Systemes, which specialises in computer-assisted design/manufacture (CADCAM) programmes, would not be part of the merged group.
Dassault Systemes "is not intended to remain part of the merged group because of the nature of its business and its clients," the source said.
The official said a name for the merged company had not yet been chosen.

The official said France's privatisation commission would be charged with the matter in the coming days. The commission will have to decide the value of the two companies and set the parities of the merger.
The finance ministry said on Tuesday that Dassault and Aerospatiale would be merged into one company with a single supervisory board and a board of directors.
The defence ministry official said the government will decide the precise terms of the merger after the commission approves the overall plan.
